results.firPara: Watchdog finds Sir Bernard Hogan-Howe not guilty of misconduct despite finding he made false claim about giving evidence
results.secPara: Britains most senior police officer gave a misleading account about the evidence he provided following the Hillsborough disaster in 1989, but he remains innocent of any misconduct, the Independent Police Complaints Commission has found.
results.webTitle: Met chief gave misleading Hillsborough account, IPCC finds

results.firPara: Give the one you love something special this year a free subscription to The Fiver. The gift that never starts giving
results.secPara: Give the one you love something special this year a free subscription to The Fiver. The gift that never starts giving

results.firPara: Danny Rose said Tottenham Hotspur have been stuck in third gear this season but he feels the wing-back system used in the 3-0 home win over Hull City could lead to greater fluency.
results.secPara: Mauricio Pochettino switched to a 3‑4‑2‑1 formation on Wednesday, with Kyle Walker and Rose as the wing-backs, as he sought to get the principal providers of pace and width higher up the pitch.
results.webTitle: Tottenham have been stuck in third gear this season, admits Danny Rose

results.firPara: If you listen, you may hear the sound of sleigh bells approaching. If you listen even closer you will realise you are wrong and that the ringing is coming from the tills in club shops.
results.secPara: Tis the season to splash out on consumer durables and football clubs certainly arent about to miss out on the action. On Premier League websites you can find customised PlayStation cases at Bournemouth, Southamptons special range of watches, Hull Citys tiger-inspired wrapping paper and, at Liverpool, a photo of Sadio Mané in Santa gear looking overwhelmed by a gift.
results.webTitle: Nothing says Christmas more than Celtic’s Leigh Griffiths dressed as an elf

results.firPara: Jürgen Klopp was right to take Loris Karius out of the spotlight, Tottenhams back three can set their full-backs free and Marcos Rojo has not learned
results.secPara: Jürgen Klopp was right to take Loris Karius out of the spotlight, Tottenhams back three can set their full-backs free and Marcos Rojo has not learned
results.webTitle: Premier League: 10 talking points from the midweek action

results.firPara: Todays fluff is waiting for the sun
results.secPara: Todays fluff is waiting for the sun
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Ross Barkley to leave Everton for Spurs?

results.firPara: The cameras attempted to pan towards Liverpools dropped goalkeeper on more than one occasion here but no one was really noticing. Jürgen Klopps side made sure that Loris Karius was not the story on a night when Adam Lallana starred in a convincing victory and they played the kind of scintillating football that has become their trademark this season.
results.secPara: Simon Mignolet replaced Karius after his recent errors but the saga that dominated the build-up to this game was soon forgotten. Liverpool started steadily after dropping points in their last two games but when they hit their stride Middlesbrough were simply no match. If the hosts manager, Aitor Karanka, was being brutally honest a three-goal defeat was probably not the worst result.
results.webTitle: Lallana scores twice to ease Liverpool to victory over Middlesbrough

results.firPara: They say perfection is a flame that many touch but few can hold. If so, Chelsea are showing every indication of possessing sufficient ruthless consistency to achieve it this season, with the latest, fairly compelling, evidence arriving at Sunderlands expense.
results.secPara: A 10th straight Premier League win left Antonio Contes team six points clear at the top of the table on a night when Cesc Fàbregas not only scored the winning goal but, courtesy of a high-calibre central-midfield performance, reminded everyone of his enduring importance in west London.
results.webTitle: Fàbregas sweeps Chelsea past Sunderland and six points clear at top

results.firPara: José Mourinho has insisted Marcos Rojo is an aggressive but clean player after the defender risked a red card by launching into another two-footed challenge during Manchester Uniteds 2-1 victory against Crystal Palace.
results.secPara: Rojo lunged at Wilfried Zaha during the first half at Selhurst Park, with the game still goalless, but was only booked by the referee, Craig Pawson. The Argentina international had been guilty of a similar offence against Idrissa Gueye in the recent draw at Everton, earning a yellow card from Michael Oliver that night at Goodison Park. From the sidelines, it did look bad, said the Palace manager, Alan Pardew, of Rojos latest offence. He jumps two-footed on [Zaha], and weve been to all these meetings where [were told] thats a red card.
results.webTitle: José Mourinho defends ‘clean’ Marcos Rojo after lunge at Wilfried Zaha

results.firPara: Salomón Rondón scored a second-half hat-trick of headers to keep West Bromwich Albion airborne in the Premier League and Swansea City flapping near the foot of the table. It was the Venezuela internationals first three-goal haul for his club and took his tally to the season to seven from 15 league matches, an excellent strike rate for a player who often fulfils a lonely role up front in a team that is not always minded to attack.
results.secPara: Albions ambitions are growing, however, and this win propelled them back to seventh in the table.
results.webTitle: West Brom’s Salomón Rondón swamps Swansea City with headed hat-trick
